title: Virtusa Announces New ADOPT Offering Aimed at Accelerating Pega Testing
text:
[September 24, 2015] Virtusa Announces New ADOPT Offering Aimed at Accelerating Pega Testing 
Virtusa Corporation (NASDAQ: VRTU), a global business consulting and IT outsourcing company that combines innovation, technology leadership and industry solutions to transform the customer experience, today announced the availability of its ADOPT (Accelerated Domain solutions for Pega Testing) framework. The comprehensive testing platform for Pega based applications will help deliver cost optimization without compromising on overall quality. 
As burgeoning new technology is putting power into customers' devices, it is also placing a tremendous amount of pressure on organizations to innovate and introduce new products and services at an unprecedented pace. As a result, enterprises are making huge investments in business process management (BPM), not just to automate operations but to drive a positive, consistent and relevant end-user experience. While companies digitize and transform their business with Pega, they are challenged to reduce cost of quality and deliver in an agile environment with defect-free, right-first-time applications. 
"Enterprises are at the cusp of fundamental change in the market environment due to digital technologies driving business transformation across industries," said Chinthi Weerasinghe, vice president and joint-head of the ISQ practice at Virtusa. "Our new ADOPT offering is helping businesses to not only reduce the downstream risks due to poor quality, but more importantly to accelerate implementation cycles leading to faster time to market of high quality solutions. We're excited to be a trusted partner enterprises can turn to for seamless implementation." 
In addition to its proprietary ADOPT methodology, companies turning to Virtusa for Pega implementation will reap the benfits of the company's 14 years of Pega experience developing framework which has helped countless global organizations achieve cost optimization without compromising on quality and application availability. 
Virtusa's BPM practice helps enterprises optimize, automate and manage business processes through design and implementation of BPM platforms. Virtusa has a dedicated Center of Excellence for Pegasystems ( News - Alert ), an industry leader in BPM software solutions, and is a trusted Pegasystems Platinum partner. From early 2003, the company has developed vertical applications using Pega's PRPC core platform and Solution Frameworks including Process Manager (CPM), Smart Dispute and Smart Investigate. 
"Virtusa's ADOPT offering is evidence of the growing maturity of testing services," said Dominique Raviart, ITO research director at NelsonHall. "The main benefit of ADOPT is to structure in a consistent manner Virtusa internal and Pegasystems external capabilities and technology." 
For more information on the ADOPT framework, visit: http://www.virtusa.com/services/independent-software-quality/specialized-qa-offerings/pega-testing-adopt-framework/ 
Analyst Dominique Raviart's blog post analyzing the ADOPT framework is available here: http://research.nelson-hall.com/blogs-webcasts/nelsonhall-blog/?avpage-views=blog&type=post&post_id=418 
About Virtusa Virtusa provides end-to-end information technology (IT) services to Global 2000 companies. These services, which include IT consulting, application maintenance, development, systems integration and managed services, leverage a unique Platforming methodology that transforms clients' businesses through IT rationalization. Virtusa helps customers accelerate business outcomes by consolidating, rationalizing, and modernizing their core customer-facing processes into one or more core systems. 
Virtusa delivers cost-effective solutions through a global delivery model, applying advanced methods such as Agile ( News - Alert ) and Accelerated Solution Design to ensure that its solutions meet the clients' requirements. As a result, its clients simultaneously reduce their IT operations cost while increasing their ability to meet changing business needs. 
Founded in 1996 and headquartered in Massachusetts, Virtusa has operations in North America, Europe, and Asia.
